metadata.title: CVE-2020-16024 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Heap buffer overflow in UI in Google Chrome prior to 87.0.4280.66 allowed aremote attacker who had compromised the renderer process to potentiallyperform a sandbox escape via a crafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-16024` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 87.0.4280.66-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 87.0.4280.66-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 87.0.4280.66-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 87.0.4280.66-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 87.0.4280.66-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '87.0.4280.66-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
